name: Bala Feesh presents: Wanton Bishops
description:
Free show, limited seats, reserve early :)

To reserve: 
1) Click on 'Request Invitation'
2) Click 'Confirm' button when you receive an email
3) Tickets will be automatically sent to your email

Orders more than 5 tickets will not be approved :)

Bala Feesh بلا فيش presents The Wanton Bishops
Hosted by Hana Malhas Music Page
In the comfort of خرابيش Kharabeesh's Living Room,

Help us spread the word about Bala Feesh by sharing videos from our past shows: http://www.balafeesh.com

Bala Feesh is a concert series, intimate live shows featuring independent musicians in the Arab world....caught on tape.
Stripped-down sets, unlikely collaborations.
For listeners. For storytelling. For a good time.

Shows are filmed, so please arrive on time :) Doors 8:00pm, show 8:30pm.

In collaboration with Music Basha

RBMA Quarter Tone Frequency
http://www.rbmaradio.com/categories/local-spotlights/formats/quarter-tone-frequency

Sponsored by Zain and Red Bull

name: SAMSUNG AMMAN MARATHON
description:
SAMSUNG AMMAN MARATHON 24/10/2014
(42,195 km, 21 km, 10 km)
Children’s Race 17/10/2014
RUN TO THE HEART OF THE CITY OF AMMAN! 

RACE CATEGORIES 24/10/2014


Race Starting Time Starting Point Gathering Time Gathering Point
Marathon 42.195 KM 6:00 AM Greater Amman Municipality 4:30 AM Al Hussein Sports City
Half-Marathon 21 KM 7:30 AM Jaish St. under Jisr Dukhan 6:30 AM Al Hussein Sports City
Fun Run 10 KM 9:00 AM The Regency Palace Hotel 8:00 AM Al Hussein Sports City
 
  • The Main gathering point for 42.195 Km, 21 km and 10 Km runners will be at Al Hussein Sports City.
  • Parking will be available at Al Hussein Sports City (a designated area will be clearly marked).
  • Buses will be available to shuttle the 42.195km and 21 km runners to the starting points. Runners will gather at Al Hussein Sports City.
  • 10 km Fun Run participants will walk to the starting point from the gathering point.
  • Buses will be available at the celebration area and the finish line to shuttle all participants back to the gathering point (Al Hussein Sports City) after the race, (available at the new Raghadan Complex / Service Complex).
CHILDREN’S RACE 17/10/2014

Race Starting Time Starting Point Gathering Time Gathering Point
Children’s Race 9:00 AM King Al Hussein Park
opposite to the fifth pitch (football field)		 8:00 AM King Al Hussein Park
opposite to the fifth pitch (football field)
Age Groups From 6-14 years old. Participants above 14 will be considered as a companion
  • The Children’s Race will take place a week before the official marathon on Friday 17th of October 2014 at King Al Hussein Park.
  • The finish line of the Children’s Race is located at the fifth pitch (football field/marathon village).
  • All participants’ must bring their birth certificates in order to register.
  • Special gifts and prizes will be available to the top 3 finishers (male/female) in each of the following categories:
  • 6-8 years old
  • 9-11 years old
  • 12-14 years old
REGISTRATION FEES

Segment Registration Fees
* Jordanians and Non-Jordanians Residing in Jordan (above 18) JOD 15
* Jordanians and Non-Jordanians Residing in Jordan (under 18) JOD 10
Non-Jordanians (above 18 ) $ 100
Non-Jordanians (under 18) $ 50
Companion JOD 10
  • Jordanians must show their Jordanian ID card, and Non-Jordanians residing in Jordan must show Residency Permit in order to register.
  • Registration fees include, race entry, timing chip, race BIB number, an official race bag and a T-shirt.
  • All participants must follow registration instructions in order to become official runners.
  • Once the registration form is submitted, there will be no fee refunds for participants who decide not to take part in the event.
  • The organizers reserve the right to cancel or postpone the race without any prior notification.
REGISTER AT
  • Run Jordan Office – shmeisani – Tel. 06-5662999
  • www.runjordan.com/registrationfo
  • Cosmo & City Mall, Fitness First Starting from the 15th of Sept till the 18th Oct.
WHAT’S AFTER REGISTRATION? PICK-UP
  • Each runner must collect his/her Running Packet between Sunda y 19th October and Thursday 23rd October (from 12:00 noon till 09:00p.m.) at the Marathon Village, which is located at King Al Hussein Park.
  • Participants in the Children’s Race must collect their packet from the Run Jordan office in Shmei- sani before the 14th of October.
  • Each participant must observe his/her race number upon receiv ing it, as each race has a specif- ic number, color and design. If you do need to change your number, please contact our offices immediately. We will NOT be able to change your number on the day of the race.
FINISH LINE AND CELEBRATION AREA
  • All participants will receive a finisher’s medal at the finish line
  • Entertainment (adults and kids), and refreshments will be available at the celebration area.
VOLUNTEERING
  • We have different volunteering opportunities available, your employees can participate by filling out a request to volunteer on the official website www.runjordan.com or through the link located on our page on facebook.com / RunJordan
EVENT PROGRAM
  • Registration and bib number pickups will be located at the Ma rathon Village from Sunday, October 19th until Thursday, October 23rd (from 12:00 noon until 9:00p.m.).
  • The Awards Ceremony will take place on the same day of the Marathon (October 24th) at the Roman Amphitheater for the 42.195km, 21km, and 10km races.
  • The Awards Ceremony for the Children's Race will take place at the Marathon Village, immediately after the race on Friday, October 17th, at King Al Hussein Park.
RACE ROUTES

42.195 KM Marathon Route. Starting time is 06:00a.m (24/10/2014)
  • The 42 km race beings from the front of the main building of the Greater Amman Municipality, heading towards King Talal Street and passing by Al Husseini Mosque towards Al Hashimi Street.
  • The runners will then head towards the Roman Amphitheater ont o Quraish Street and in the direc- tion towards Ali Bin Abi Taleb Street. They will continue their route towards Omar Matar Street, passing by the main gate of GAM.
  • The runners will run in the direction of King Talal Street again, then onto Al Hashimi Street, arriving at Al Jaish Street in the direction of the New Raghadan Bus Sta tion.
  • The runners will make a U-turn from the middle roundabout and cross the street to the other direction of Al Jaish Street, passing by the Roman Amphitheatre four times, back and forth.
  • After the fourth time, the runners will arrive at their finish ing point in front of the Amphitheatre.
Note: The entire 42.195km route will go in the opposite direction of traffic (4 Laps).

21 KM Race Route. Starting time is at 07:30a.m (24/10/2014)
  • The 21km race begins from Al-Jayesh Street, under Al-Dukhan B ridge heading towards Hashemite Square.
  • The runners will then pass by Hashemite Square and continue t owards Quraysh Street.
  • From Quraysh Street, runners will continue on towards Ali Abi Ibee Talib Street and from there make a U-turn at the end of the Greater Amman Municipality (GAM ) building.
  • Runners will continue towards Omar Matr Street passing by GAM from the main gate, continuing towards King Talal Street.
  • From King Talal Street, runners continue to Hashemite Street.
  • From Hashemite Street, runners continue to Al-Jayesh Street, towards the new Raghdan Bus Station, going in the opposite direction of traffic.
  • Runners will then make a U-turn at the island, going on the o pposite side of Al-Jayesh Street, then continuing past the front of the Roman Amphitheatre for another loop. At the end of the second lap, runners will enter the finish area in bedside of the Roman Amphitheatre.
Note: The entire 21km route will go in the opposite direction of traffic, which consists of half of the 42.195km route (2 Laps).

10 KM Race Route. Starting time is 09:00a.m (24/10/2014)
  • The 10km race begins on the opposite side of Regency Palace Hotel, on Queen Alia Street, going towards Dakhlea Circle.
  • From Dakhlea Circle, runners continue to Queen Noor Street, towards 4th Circle).
  • From Dakhlea Circle, runners continue to Queen Noor Street, towards 4th Circle).
  • From the 4th Circle, runners will continue to Zahran Street a nd then make a right turn at the first road, continuing towards Khalidee Hospital.
  • Runners will then take the first right going towards a small c ircle (which leads to the 4th Circle). From here, runners will go directly to Aqba bin Nafea Street, which will take them to the Wadee Abdoun traffic lights.
  • Runners will go left (in the opposite direction of traffic) to wards Princess Bassma Street, towards Wadee Abdoun, where they will continue running under Abdoun Bridge.
Children’s Race Route. Starting time is 09:00a.m (17/10/2014)
  • Children will gather for the race opposite to the 5th footbal l pitch (field). Cars will enter from the exit gate, which is across from the visitors entrance of Medical Cit y Hospital.
  • The race will start in front of the 5th football pitch (field) inside King Hussein Park (going in the opposite direction of traffic).
  • After the start, runners will go up a long incline and continue towards King Hussein Mosque.
  • Runners will go past King Hussein Mosque (the mosque will be on the right) and continue on the path that will lead past the Children’s Museum and the Automobile Museum (also on the right side), towards the employees entrance.
  • From there, runners will descend down a hill towards the car exit and go towards the entrance gate.
  • Runners will continue past the parking lot (on the left) to t he finish line, which is across from the 5th football pitch (field).
Note: The celebration area and awards ceremony will take place inside the area where the Marathon Village is located.

Cash prizes & incentives Awarded for competitive athletes
















Map

name: Brian Tracy: Learn The key Secrets for Advanced Selling Strategies for Top Professionals
description:
WORKSHOP CONTENTS

Part One: 
The Psychology of Selling
You will learn:
  • Get what you want, faster than you ever thought possible 
  • Easily rally the people around you to help you reach your goals 
  • Become absolutely indispensable to your company and climb the ladder fast 
  • Dramatically increase your income 
  • Gain control over every aspect of your life 

Part Two: 
Why People Buy
Learn the basic rule of selling, how to understand buying psychology, the aim of all buying behavior, seven key question you must answer, 2 things you must accomplish, conducting a GAP analysis with each prospect, helping customers reduce risk.

Part Three: 
Influence and Persuasion Strategies
Learn why some customers buy quickly, without hesitation & others don't, the most powerful buying influence, the Low of Incremental Commitment, the importance of emotion in selling, the use of authority to overcome objection, the power of scarcity.

Part Four: 
Relationship Selling
The success of a business or a sales career depends on relationships selling and customer loyalty. In today’s competitive market, customers are very difficult and expensive to acquire and they can represent tremendous value to an organization. In fact, customer satisfaction can be the most valuable single asset that a company can acquire during its lifetime. Your job, no matter where you are in the private sector, is to help your company attract, acquire and keep customers indefinitely. They make all the difference between success and failure.

Part Five:
Identifying Needs Accurately
Asking good questions to learn exactly how and why your product or service is the ideal choice for this customer. The most important thing you can do as a salesperson is uncover the true needs or problems of the prospect that your product can solve.

Part Six: 
Closing the Sale
Closing the sale is a logical step in a professional sales process. You first assure that the customer has no lingering questions or objections and then you invite the customer to make a buying decision. This should be simple, straightforward and stress-free.
There are practiced, professional ways of asking for the sale that are ideal for different products and services. One of your jobs is to learn how to close the sale painlessly and professionally and move on to completing the paperwork and delivering the product or service.

Part Seven: 
Getting Re-sales and Referrals
The final step in the sales process is taking such good care of the customer that the customer buys from you again and again, and tells his or her friends.
The key to getting referrals is to “be referable.” Respond quickly to customer needs or problems. Ask for referrals after each customer interaction. Follow-up and report back to the customer with what happened when you contacted the referral.
The good news is that every salesperson in the top 10% today started in the bottom 10%. All sales skills are learnable. You can learn any sales skill you need to learn to achieve any sales goal you can set for yourself. There are no limits except the limits you place on yourself.
Your ability to sell more, better, faster, and more efficiently than before is the key not only to your personal success as a salesperson, but to the success of your company, as well.

name: The MENA ICT Forum 2014
description:
The MENA ICT ForumTM (www.menaictforum.com) is the MENA region’s premier biennial ICT industry event, held in Jordan, under the Royal Patronage of His Majesty King Abdullah II. Previously organized with great success, in 2002; 2004; and 2006 as “Jordan ICT Forum”, and in 2010 and 2013 as “MENA ICT Forum, the Forum showcases the entire MENA region’s ICT success stories, and discusses latest trends, opportunities and future outlook.

The MENA ICT ForumTM features content-rich agenda that covers vital current and future issues related to regional investment climates, legislative supportive systems, infrastructure & communications, emerging technologies, as well as education & human capital development. In particular, the MENA ICT ForumTM addresses these issues in a context that is highly relevant to the MENA region, thus providing the business community, decision makers and stakeholders with a holistic overview of the region’s current position, opportunities on hand and recommended approach for leveraging its potential.

Furthermore, ICT globally has been taking a deeper sectorial focus such as ICT in Education, Health, Banking, Insurance, CleanTech, Fashion, and other sectors, hence the MENA ICT Forum addresses main vertical sectors and ICT integration/diffusion in those as key areas to increase productivity and accelerate economic development.

Moreover, the Forum provides a platform for renowned keynote speakers to offer their global perspectives about the MENA region and provide valuable advice and insight. Keynote speakers included H.M. King Abdullah II, Intel’s CEO Dr. Craig Barrett, Cisco’s Chairman, Mr. John Chambers, 3Com’s CEO, Mr. Edgar Masri, Devoteam Co-Founder and Co-CEO, Mr. Stanislas de Bentzmann, Amazon CTO & VP, Dr. Werner Vogels, Sun Microsystems’ Chief Researcher, Mr. John Gage, Mrs. Catherine Rodgers, IBM SVP, Mr. Fadi Ghandour, Founder and Vice Chairman Aramex, Mr. Kieth Teare, Co-founder TechCrunch, among others.

name: JoAnimate
description:
“JoAnimate Festival, Creative Jordan”; is the MENA region’s leading animation and creative arts & designs event held in Jordan, previously organized with huge success in 2012 as “Jordan Animation Festival” under the Royal Patronage of HRH Princess Sumaya Bint El Hassan.

The Festival covers various components, including hands- on training and workshops for talented individuals and young professionals, to interact and learn from international industry experts on new trends and technologies in animation, designs and production. The Festival also gives the chance for talented individuals to shine and show their capabilities through a Competition for “Short Animated Movies” that will be processed ahead of time, including a Screening Night for the best videos selected, and an Awards Ceremony for the top 3 videos. 

Moreover, this year’s Festival 2014 will feature Regional Talents & Business Platform & Forum that will showcase talented and leading regional companies in the areas of animation, gaming, digital media, creative designs and production, and allow them to interact with regional and international speakers and participants, to support growing the regional animation ecosystem and industry, and enable potential business opportunities creation.

name: AYLA DEAD2RED CYCLING RACE
description:
Greetings Amman Road Runners and Cyclists,

We hope you agree that our 17th Dead2Red Relay Race in March was a great success, despite the difficult weather conditions! We had record numbers attending the event, with nearly 1000 people at the Awards Ceremony and Dinner. We have had time to reflect on the logistics of our race and have a very exciting announcement to make. This coming November 14, 2014 will see our 1st Dead2Red Cycling Race! (The Dead2Red Running Race will remain in March.)

We are sure that separating the cycling from the running will prove to be beneficial for everyone:

- It will allow everyone to participate in both events, instead of having to choose.
- The cycling categories have been amended to make an even playing field for all participants.
- The race will be held entirely during daylight hours, starting on Friday at 6am and finishing at 4pm on the same day.
- The race will remain on the same road, but will have a slightly shorter distance of approximately 200 km. 
- The weather in November should allow you to ride safely without the risk of strong winds, heavy rain, sand storms, or mud slides! 

We believe you will have a safer and more enjoyable racing experience!

More exciting details will follow shortly, but you will find our registration form and waiver attached so that you can enjoy our special "Repeat Performance" discount. If you participated in the 17th Dead2Red Relay Race (cycling OR running), your personal discount will apply until the deadline of November 8th. 

Start planning now for our 1st Dead2Red Cycling Race, redefined. Arrange to have your bicycle shipped over, start recruiting your friends and colleagues for a team, convince your family members to visit Jordan during November and take advantage of this new opportunity. 

Enjoy your summer, and don’t forget to join us on Friday mornings at the International Community School for our Meet, Run/Walk/Cycle and Go! Training never starts too early!
teaser: Greetings Amman Road Runners and Cyclists, We hope you agree that our 17th Dead2Red Relay Race in March was a great success, despite the difficult weather conditions! We had record numbers attending the event, with nearly 1000 people at the Awards Ce...
